definitions.body: tower Ge 11:4, Ge 11:5, Ju Jdg 8:9. Jdg 9:51, Jdg 9:51, Jdg 9:52, Jdg 9:52. 2Ki 9:17. 2Ki 17:9. 2Ki 18:8. 1Ch 27:25. 2Ch 14:6. 2Ch 26:9, 2Ch 26:10, 2Ch 26:11, 2Ch 27:4. 2Ch 32:5. Ne 3:25, Ne 3:26, Ne 3:27, Is 2:15. Is 30:25. Is 33:18, Ez Eze 26:4, Eze 26:9, Eze 27:11, Ps 48:13, watch-tower in vineyard Is 5:2; fig. of God as refuge Ps 61:4, Pr 18:10; beautiful neck like tower of David Ct So 4:4; an ivory tower So 7:5; breasts So 8:10. (Cf. MI:22 [[מגדלתה]], Sab. (more precisely Lihyân) [[מגדלנהן]], Eut, v. DHM:Epigr. Denkm. 4, 1. 5). Special towers mentioned on Lebanon Ct So 7:5, Penuel Ju Jdg 8:17, Shechem Ju Jdg 9:46, Jdg 9:47, Jdg 9:49; and at Jerusalem, the tower of David Ct So 4:4 (the arsenal), [[מֵאָה]] Ne 3:1, [[חֲנַנְאֵל]] Ne 3:1, Ne 12:39, Je 31:38, Zec 14:10, [[תַּנּוּרִים]] Ne 3:11, Ne 12:38 (tower of the furnaces).
elevated stage, pulpit of wood Ne 8:4.
raised bed ‖[[עֲרוּגׇה]] Ct So 5:13, but LXX Vulgate Hi Bö De rightly rd. [[מְגַדְּלוֹת]].
